intro: Eritrichium illapelinum, commonly known as the Illapelin alpine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in South America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, delicate flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are usually blue or violet in color, with four petals arranged in a cross shape, typical of the family. Eritrichium illapelinum is known for its resilience to harsh environmental conditions, making it a notable species in alpine ecosystems.
